Great few days for the XCAD Ecosystem. Data report published next week. 

Have a great weekend ğŸ’ª

XCAD as a whole is in the most promising position it has ever been in. Today I will outline our go-to-market strategy around Watch2Earn and how we will create mass adoption.

We can categorise our web2 users into THREE main groups: Traders, Perk consumers and Watch2Earn competitors. I will focus on the Watch2Earn strategy below â¬‡ï¸

The XCAD application is completely free to use for Watch2Earn, integrated directly alongside YouTube to allow users to get rewarded for activities they already do. It is highly available - supported on Android, Mobile (via PWA) and most Browser platforms.

Users receive a very small amount of Creator Tokens for watching videos - and they also score points. These points are earned based on a number of factors:
- Video Duration
- Video Recency (Video age)
- Video Frequency (Videos watched in a period of time)

Points contribute towards a leaderboard, with each Creator having their own. The higher you rank when the leaderboard period ends, the bigger the prizes you will earn.

Leaderboards will refresh periodically, beginning with our first which runs until the end of July, refreshing monthly thereafter.

We have life-changing prizes on offer for our inaugural leaderboards:
ğŸ¥‡ 1st Place - $10,000
ğŸ¥ˆ 2nd Place - $5,000
...and many more prizes for the top 50 users ğŸ’°

In order to rank on the leaderboard, users need to claim their points every day, this is an on chain transaction and gas is covered by the XCAD team (to start) if a user does one of the following:

- Purchases XCAD via our payment gateways
- Refers a friend to the app
- Signs up using a referral code

All of this means a seamless web2 experience. The app uses no web3 terminology. It is a web2 experience.

Now what happens after onboarding hundreds of thousands of users, if not millions of users fast? We can, for example, introduce a very light premium model:

You earn more points if you hold $1-$5 of XCAD in your wallet (example numbers, but low ticket) and you can earn random rewards for watching videos. For example, you may randomly win $1,000 regardless of ranking on the leaderboards.

Mass users will use the new XCAD gateway which has no KYC, with a minimum purchase of $1. All of this means real demand from real users, not speculators, on a mass scale. Affordable and scalable.

I know things are taking a bit longer than expected, however, this is a new space with a very new concept.

This is just highlighting a rough go-to-market strategy for Watch2Earn. We still have the trading and perk sides which I will cover in another thread later on.

The future is bright for XCAD, I believe we have a great Go-To-Market Strategy & we can become a leading dApp.

@XcademyOfficial

A new post by @fcmartinelli appeared on the @Balancer forum, sharing his thoughts on the protocolâ€™s future.   

Hereâ€™s a quick summary for those with diminished attention spans. ğŸ‘‡   

Balancer v2 has already proven to be the place for developers to experiment with new and innovative AMM designs permissionlessly. Protocols like @GyroStable and @XaveFinance can quickly tap into Balancerâ€™s network, integrations, and incentivization mechanism.   

v3 will make it even easier for new protocols to build on top of Balancer by removing a ton of complexity, resulting in a 10x improvement for developers. It also introduces hooks, which opens up brand-new design possibilities.   

The vision is for Balancer v3 to focus on fungible and yield-bearing liquidity. Concentrated liquidity, pioneered by Uniswap, has proven successful for major pairs like ETH-USDC but is rarely practical for the long tail of tokens and lacks composability. As more projects launch, that long tail is growing larger each day. Meanwhile, Gyroscopeâ€™s E-CLPs provide a great option for stablecoin projects.   

Balancer v2 already emphasizes liquidity for yield-bearing tokens, but the vision is for v3 to take this even further. v3 reimplements boosted pools that direct 100% of LP liquidity to onchain lending markets while abstracting this from users and utilizing a buffer to ensure gas efficiency.   

For LPs to further increase profitability, minimizing MEV is essential. Balancer v3 aims to reclaim MEV for LPs by partnering with intent-centric projects, most notably @CoWSwap. Their recent proposal would create a strategic partnership between the two protocols and a plan to build COWAMM on top of Balancer.  

Thereâ€™s a lot to be excited about within the Balancer ecosystem: deploying on more chains, an updated UI, new partners building innovative AMMs, and v3, which is expected to launch in Q4 this year. As always, security remains the highest priority, and several rounds of audits and code-review competitions are planned.

#FlokiFi Locker, #Floki's mainstream crypto locker protocol, is experiencing impressive adoption, with a growing number of projects entrusting it to securely lock their liquidity and other digital assets.

Why are projects choosing @FlokiFi Locker to secure their crypto? Let's break it down ğŸ‘‡

1ï¸âƒ£ Almost Infinite Period of Time
FlokiFi Locker lets users lock tokens for a practically infinite period of time; you can lock for 420 years (for the culture!) or for tens of thousands of years just to make a statement that your LP tokens will be inaccessible for as long as humans can live.

2ï¸âƒ£ Extend Locks
You can extend locks for assets locked with FlokiFi Locker for however long you want, even if the duration for the locks have yet to expire.

3ï¸âƒ£ ERC-1155 Multi Token Standard
FlokiFi Locker is the only digital asset locker solution with support for the ERC-1155 multi token standard. It allows you to lock a combination of fungible tokens, non-fungible tokens (NFTs), and other token types, deployed through a single contract all in one transaction.

4ï¸âƒ£ Vest Tokens
FlokiFi Locker also allows you to securely vest your tokens and have them released at your preferred schedule. Vest fungible tokens, LP tokens, and multi-tokens all in a few clicks.

5ï¸âƒ£ Burn Functionality
You can directly burn your LP tokens, fungible tokens, NFTs, and ERC-1155 tokens through the FlokiFi Locker app.

6ï¸âƒ£ Referral Program
Earn 25% of the transaction fee for every successful lock you refer. There is no limit to the number or value of locks you can refer, so there is no cap on how much you can earn by getting projects to lock with FlokiFi Locker.

7ï¸âƒ£ Support for Multiple Blockchains
FlokiFi Locker is a multi-chain protocol with support for 15 EVM compatible blockchains. These are ETH, BSC, Base, Blast, Arbitrum, Polygon, Fantom, AVAX, Optimism, KCC, OKXChain, opBNB, Cronos, Evmos, and Dogechain.

This is the highest number of blockchains supported by any protocol of this nature in the industry.

8ï¸âƒ£ Securing the Web3 World
FlokiFi Locker smart contracts are built by some of the most talented blockchain devs in the industry. In addition, these contracts have been thoroughly audited and are monitored 24/7 by the industry's most recognized security auditor, Certik. You can be assured that you are using the most secure locker protocol in the industry when you use FlokiFi Locker!

9ï¸âƒ£ How is FlokiFi related to Floki?
FlokiFi is a utility product within the Floki Ecosystem and is powered by $FLOKI tokens; this means you can pay with USDT (or other available tokens in the FlokiFi UI) and the protocol automatically gets the FLOKI token required to process your transaction without you having to manually buy the Floki token. 

Every lock on the protocol burns $FLOKI tokens on chains we're tradable. This makes the FLOKI token deflationary!

Pendle offers an array of assets across various maturities, both short and long dated.

@ether_fi eETH (Dec 2024) for instance is offering historically the highest EtherFi Loyalty Points multiplier at 4x (just in time for S3).

#3 Select Target Pool

Click on the dropdown to select a new home for your liquidity.

The dropdown will show all the available pools within the same network (i.e. Ethereum, Arbitrum) and their respective APYs.

#2 - Adjust Balance to be Transferred

Next, you can key in the amount of liquidity to be transferred.

This will be 100% by default.

<Claim All Pool Rewards> will also be toggled on by default.

To view matured pools, remember to switch to the "Inactive" tab on the pool page.

Alternatively, you can also access the pool page from your Pendle Dashboard. https://t.co/CiZjV4DB4t

Liquidity Transfer

#1 - Select Transfer Liquidity

When @CoWSwap enters the room, you know itâ€™s time to pay attention. CoW AMM is unlike anything else in DeFi and will usher in a new era of LP profitability.   

Whereâ€™s itâ€™s being built? Balancer!  
Where will CoW AMM LPs will boost their yield? Aura!  

A quick ELI5 explanation ğŸ‘‡ 

What is CoW AMM and why does it matter?  

When tokens get swapped in a DEX, the price of those tokens change in that specific pool. But there are lots of pools across DeFi and centralized exchanges, and they all have slightly different prices.   

Arbitrage traders buy the tokens from one pool at a cheaper price and sell them on another pool for more. Their profit comes at the expense of LPs in whatâ€™s know as Loss Versus Rebalancing (LVR).   

This is how AMMs in DeFi work today, with LPs having their position constantly eroded by LVR. CoW AMM is designed differently.   

Essentially, there are special CoW AMM pools for solvers to use. Whenever thereâ€™s an arbitrage opportunity, the solvers bid and whichever one offers the most surplus to the pool gets to rebalance it.   

This eliminates LVR for LPs while protecting them from MEV bots.  

CoW AMM will be closely integrated with Balancer and Aura. Theyâ€™ll benefit from Balancerâ€™s trusted brand and interface, experience bringing novel AMM designs to market, tapping into Balancerâ€™s liquidity, incentivization mechanism, data tracking, and more.   

In return, CoW DAO brings a new product to @Balancer that will bring in a new era of AMM innovation. There will also be revenue splits and token swaps to further align incentives.

RT @phtevenstrong: I never trust a zoomer to do math, even if @SiloIntern  and @PendleIntern are two of the best spreadsheet interns out there.

So I checked myself.

Current rates:
â€¢ 11% Borrow Cost on USDC
â€¢ 19.97% Fixed Yield on PT USDe
â€¢ 87% LTV

The Millennial's Math:
â–º Leverage = (1 / (1-LTV)) 
= (1 / (1-0.87) = 7.69
â–º Leveraged Collateral Yield = Leverage * PT Yield
= 7.69 * 19.97% = 153.62%
â–º Leveraged Debt Interest = (Leverage - 1) * Interest
= (7.69 - 1) * 11% = 73.615%
â–º Net Leveraged Yield = 
Leveraged Collateral Yield - Leveraged Debt Interest
= 153.62% - 73.615% 
= 80% APR

So the zoomer's math was right, and even after interest rates on USDC increased, the yield is still >=80%.

Not bad, zoomer, not bad.

Now WHY is this opportunity available? 

Currently Silo has ARB LTIPP rewards and is subsidizing lending to this market. 

That makes the current APR for lending 23.5% on USDC.

This pushes the borrow cost down as more lenders are eager to farm incentives.

Note: be careful with max leverage, there's only a 5% liquidation buffer. That means USDe could depeg by 5.43% before liquidation.

Disclaimer: I'm a Silo Ambassador, therefore biased to highlight their yields ğŸ«¡

RT @letsgethai: How HAI? ğŸªâ›…ï¸
A quick explainer on the mechanics at work in Let's Get HAI

HAI has a controlled peg, unlike USDC or USDT which are hard pegged to the Dollar.  

The peg is set autonomously by a PI controller and is represented as the system's Redemption Price.  The redemption price/peg started at $1, but will change over time.  

How does it work?ğŸŒ¥ï¸ 
HAI has two prices: the market price (MP) and the redemption price (RP). 

The delta between them is one of the factors that determines whether the system's interest rates are positive or negative.  

- The MP is what HAI currently trades at on the open market. 
- The RP is what the HAI system values HAI at.  

If the MP goes over the RP, the PI controller sets a negative interest rate â€” which devalues the redemption price of HAI over time.

In the case of the MP being over the RP, the negative rate set by the controller would make the debt that users had accrued in HAI cheaper over time.  

This directly incentivizes Vault owners to mint additional HAI and sell it at a premium against the systemâ€™s value of the debt. This user activity encourages system stability.  

When the MP is below the RP, the opposite happens. The system sets a positive rate which affects the internal price of HAI (the RP) over time. 

In this example, a user could purchase HAI on the market for less than the Protocol value, paying off the userâ€™s debt at a lower price.

ğŸ¥œğŸ¥œ Distributing Arbitrum STIP Bridge Incentives

In May 2024, Thetanuts Finance became eligible to receive an additional 200,000 $ARB under the Arbitrum STIP Bridge â€“ allowing us to further incentivize users of Thetanuts Finance on Arbitrum.

Thetanuts Finance had previously received another 200,000 $ARB under Arbitrum STIP, which was awarded in November 2023.

This post seeks to outline how we intend to distribute Arbitrum STIP Bridge Incentives to members of the Thetanuts Finance community on Arbitrum, and our rationale for doing so.

ğŸŒ° Recap of Thetanuts Financeâ€™s Arbitrum STIP Incentives

Thetanuts Finance distributed our initial Arbitrum STIP Incentives over a 8-week period, distributing 25,000 $ARB to users on Arbitrum each week. Users on Arbitrum under the below categories were eligible to receive $ARB rewards:

> Users on Add Liquidity Module
> Users with Long Positions
> Users with Boosted Short Positions
> Users using Pendle PT Strategy Vaults

After the end of the 8-week distribution period, Thetanuts Finance went one step further to distribute 5,000 $ARB per week to users on Arbitrum â€“ which was paid out from the Thetanuts Finance treasury.

In order to create sticky liquidity between Arbitrum STIP and Arbitrum STIP Bridge, Thetanuts Finance also promised that 25% of $ARB rewards from Arbitrum STIP Bridge would go to users who retained their liquidity in Thetanuts Finance during the interim period.

ğŸŒ° Distributing Arbitrum STIP Bridge

We intend to distribute Arbitrum STIP Bridge over a 12-week period.

To reward sticky liquidity in Thetanuts Finance during the interim period between Arbitrum STIP and Arbitrum STIP Bridge, the 50,000 $ARB will be distributed to users that have fulfilled this criteria. This 50,000 $ARB will be distributed over the 12-week period to eligible users.

The remaining 150,000 $ARB will be distributed to liquidity providers on Thetanuts Finance over a 12-week period, according to the below breakdown.

> Users using Pendle PT Strategy Vaults: 65%
> Users on Add Liquidity Module: 20%
> Users with Long Positions: 5%
> Users with Boosted Short Positions: 10%

Note that these weights are subject to change by the Thetanuts Finance team depending on market conditions.

$ARB rewards will be available for claim on a bi-weekly basis on Mondays, on our Incentives page.

ğŸŒ° Conclusion

Weâ€™re thankful to the Thetanuts Finance community for their constant support, and for the support of Arbitrum DAO in awarding us these incentives.

RT @bjnpck: Making money with Liquity v2.

There are two ways:
- Run a Frontend
- Become an Interest Rate Delegate

Run a Frontend:
Liquity v1 pioneered the decentralized frontend model with built-in incentives. However, it quickly turned into a race to the bottom with several providers charging 0 fees. 
In v2, running a basic frontend won't be profitable either. To generate income, you'll need to charge for additional services on top. Things like automation, notifications, community features, incentives, perks, and more.

Or, you become an Delegate.

Becoming an Interest Rate Delegate:
During the registration process, you will set a kickback rate for your service. For example, if you pick 0.20% and attract $10M in user funds, that's $20K/year.

What does a delegate do?
Delegates set the optimal interest rate for their managed capital. In Liquity v2, everyone can set and change their own interest rate. If it's too high, you leave money on the table; if it's too low, you risk getting redeemed. The Delegateâ€™s role is to provide a competitive rate while minimizing redemption risk.

Strategies:
There are many ways to approach it and you can run several strategies at once servicing different user needs.

Two basic examples are:
Defensive: Users pay a higher interest rate but require minimal adjustments (less gas costs), allowing you to charge just 0.10%.
Aggressive: Always hover around the minimum rate, requiring frequent adjustments (higher gas costs), justifying a higher fee, e.g., 0.20%.

This can be a completive passive income stream by automating with on-chain data like:
- Debt in front
- The $BOLD price
- Rates on Maker, Aave...
- Stablecoin utulization on money markets

Or it can be done manually factoring in forward-looking elements like expected rate adjustments (Maker and co.), demand changes for stablecoins,  new $BOLD farms/incentives...

The possibilities are endless.

Interested?

ICYMI: we recently unveiled the next evolution of the Loopring Smart Wallet - the new Multi-Network LSWğŸ’™

The first network addition to this new wallet is @taikoxyz mainnetğŸ¥

Users can now deploy multiple Smart Accounts (smart contract powered wallets) using the same address, across multiple networks, all managed by a unique EOA wallet

full details ğŸ§µâ†“

TLDR:
The main improvements are a new, more decentralized experience with no more requirement for guardians or centralized services for new users as well as a much simpler user experience for users wanting to deploy and be able to recover the same wallet address across many networks.

----------

First, to better help you understand all of the new changes coming to the Loopring Smart Wallet - letâ€™s take a deep dive into our thought processes behind the new wallet as well as look at a breakdown of the different types of wallet options ğŸ§

â†“â†“

EOA Account vs. Smart Account:

First, letâ€™s take a close look at how a Smart Wallet differs from a typical EOA (Externally Owned Account) wallet. 

Unlike EOA, Smart Accounts are smart contracts deployed on a target network. Essentially, a Smart Account comes into existence only after the user spends network fees to deploy it on-chain. This deployment fee can be significant, particularly on networks with high gas fees like Ethereum.  

For an EOA wallet, once you know the private key, you have full access to accounts on EVM-compatible networks at that address. In contrast, for a Smart Account, you need to deploy a smart contract individually on each desired network, and each smart contract is an isolated entity.  

â†“â†“  

Multi-Network Support:

Certain conventional uses of EOA wallets become unconventional for Smart Wallets. A prime example is cross-network functionality. With EOA wallets, once a user has control on one network, they can access the same address on other EVM-compatible networks because each EOA account shares the same private key. However, with Smart Wallets, the situation becomes more complex. Each Smart Account is a smart contract deployed on each specific network even at the same address.  

Most Smart Accounts have an owner role, who can initiate transactions on behalf of the Smart Account, akin to owning the Account. The owner can be replaced via the social recovery feature of the Smart Account implementation. With social recovery, the majority of guardians must approve to reset the owner of the Smart Account to a new one.  

While social recovery is a promising security solution, which relieves users from memorizing seed phrases, it also comes with some costs. Users must pre-set guardians for each smart contract deployed on each network. In the case of recovery, users need to conduct operations for each smart contract on each deployed network (one-by-one), incurring a fee for each operation. This process can be tedious and potentially costly.  

Moreover, with the rise of Ethereum Layer 2 solutions and various Ethereum-compatible Layer 1 networks, managing multiple Smart Accounts under the same address poses challenges. If a user loses access to their Smart Accounts deployed across multiple networks, they must individually recover each account, each operation incurring gas fees, which presents a cumbersome user experience.  

As Loopring expanded its focus from an Ethereum-only Smart Wallet to a multi-network strategy, it encountered this dilemma. On one hand, users need an easy way to deploy multiple Smart Accounts under the same address; on the other hand, they need a seamless method to save and restore wallet states across networks. Social recovery isnâ€™t efficient or user-friendly in a multi-network scenario. Thus, Loopring sought a different solution.

----------

Loopringâ€™s Approach for Multi-Network:

Support After careful consideration, Loopring has decided on the following approaches:

ğŸ”¹Trustless Management:
Users now have access to the Seed Phrase of the Smart Account owner. The app reminds users to back up this Seed Phrase upon wallet creation. This means social or cloud recovery is no longer the only way to recover your account(s). Recovery via this Seed Phrase is now possible instead.

ğŸ”¹Social Login Options:
Users can quickly deploy a Smart Account by logging in with their Google/iCloud account. The Seed Phrase is encrypted with a password and uploaded to the userâ€™s trusted cloud drive. Proper access controls prevent accidental deletion of the file and unauthorized access by other apps. Loopring does not have access to this encrypted file. Users still have the option to create a Smart Account with guardian protection (social recovery). In this case, users must understand that they need to set up guardians separately for each account on each network they want to deploy. In the case of recovery, they will need to recover each deployed Smart Account one by one â€” by either Cloud recovery (if setup) or by Social (guardian) recovery.

----------

Key Terms in the new Loopring Smart Wallet:

Below is a list of terms that will now be commonly used when accessing the Loopring Smart Wallet app:

ğŸ”¹Smart Account: 
The smart contract deployed on the dedicated network.

ğŸ”¹Wallet (Smart Wallet):
The entity uniquely identified by its Wallet address. In the context of a Smart Wallet, it includes multiple Smart Accounts deployed on various EVM-compatible networks. All Smart Accounts associated with the Wallet address share the same Owner (EOA wallet), unless the user changes the Owner of a Smart Account. As long as the user can import the Ownerâ€™s Seed Phrase, the Wallet and all associated Smart Accounts can be restored using this.

ğŸ”¹Wallet Group:
Each Seed Phrase can generate multiple Wallets (multiple addresses). To minimize the effort of Seed Phrase backup, Loopring allows multiple Wallets to be created from the same Seed Phrase within given rules. These Wallets are grouped into one Wallet Group governed by the same Seed Phrase.

----------

Loopring's Decentralization Effort:

One important aspect of this new approach is Loopringâ€™s effort to decentralize the solution, removing the previous dependency on Loopring centralized services.

This new effort involves two major changes:

ğŸ”¹Cloud Backup Mechanism:
Previously, cloud backup relied on Loopringâ€™s centralized service to verify the userâ€™s identity to retrieve the encryption key. This safe solution included a middleman service, which posed a risk if Loopringâ€™s service was down. The new method allows users to pre-set an encryption password themselves. This password encrypts the Seed Phrase, which is then saved to a trusted cloud drive. Loopring does not have access to this.

ğŸ”¹Official Loopring Guardian:
In our previous Smart Account creations, the Loopring Guardian was automatically added to new wallets. 

For users that chose to not add additional guardians (and minimize this centralization risk or dependancy) - each time approval was needed, users had to interact with this Loopring service to verify 2FA information. 

To fully decentralize the Loopring Smart Wallet, the Loopring Guardian will now no longer be automatically included in any new Smart Account creations. Users can add other accounts as guardians if they wish, removing any dependency on Loopring services. If users still want to use this Loopring service, they can add the Loopring Guardian, with the understanding that the Smart Account can function properly even without Loopring Guardian.

----------

The Real Value of a â€œSmartâ€ Wallet:

At Loopring, we believe that the true uniqueness and potential of the Loopring Smart Wallet app will lie in the â€œsmartâ€ features coming to facilitate trading and earning.

Loopring is currently developing a new Smart Agent feature, which will enable Smart Wallets to perform many tasks on a decentralized, smart contract basis, direct from their self-custodial wallets. Something typically reserved only for major Centralized Exchangesâ€™ trading bots and not something a user could access in a self-custodial way.  

By leveraging the Loopring Relayer and these new Smart Agents, Loopring aims to unlock a very promising future for all Smart Wallet users.   

Join us as we introduce these exciting new features and more!

These little buggers allow you to lock in fix-rate / fix-date APRs (similar to @pendle_fi PTs) and are also leverageable on Fraxlend.

Right now, you can buy the Dec 31st 2024 bond which has a fixed APY of 9.71%, the borrow cost against the bond is 1%.

That means, at max leverage, you could earn 88% APR for the next six months.

HOWEVER, there are some caveats.

1) There's only $300K to borrow
2) As you borrow, the interest rate will increase 
(up to 7% at max utilization)
3) The price of the bond is beholden to the markets until expiry, so you would want to be conservative with your LTV

Currently, you could max leverage $33K and at that leverage, if you hit max utilization, you would get closer to 34% APR (still good) than the 88% above.

THAT'S ALL FOR NOW

As a reminder, I am an ambassador for Frax, the decentralized central bank, and am therefore quite biased in this post.

Balancer has long held the belief that yield-bearing assets will dominate DeFi.

This thesis has influenced the protocol in numerous ways and is evident with the popularity of pools paired with @LidoFinanceâ€™s wstETH.

It makes sense for protocols to pair their tokens against an LST like wstETH. Not only do LPs earn more yield, but pools that contain at least 50% yield-bearing assets are also eligible to become a Core Pool on Balancer.

With Core Pools, a portion of @Balancer protocol fees are used as vote incentives. These vote incentives lead to more emissions going to those pools, resulting in higher APR, which brings in more LPs, and results in deeper liquidity for the pools that most benefit the protocol.

With the prevalence of wstETH throughout DeFi, it shouldnâ€™t be surprising that 27 of Balancerâ€™s 79 Core Pools contain wstETH. These combine for over $84m in TVL.

For users, there are plenty of opportunities to put your wstETH to work and earn additional yield.
